body_html:
@Androbin thanks a ton for this code, it's an excellent starting point. Apologies for further questions:

  1. del node.input[2] fails in scenarios where I have node.input = ['phase_train','phase_train']. Why is this important?
  2. If I comment out del node.input[2], your code converts Switch ops to Identity ops and removes the second redundant input. However, I end up with errors such as Input 0 of node Bottleneck/BatchNorm/cond/Switch_2 was passed bool from Bottleneck/BatchNorm/cond/pred_id:0 incompatible with expected float.

Any help is greatly appreciated!
body_text:
@Androbin thanks a ton for this code, it's an excellent starting point. Apologies for further questions:

del node.input[2] fails in scenarios where I have node.input = ['phase_train','phase_train']. Why is this important?
If I comment out del node.input[2], your code converts Switch ops to Identity ops and removes the second redundant input. However, I end up with errors such as Input 0 of node Bottleneck/BatchNorm/cond/Switch_2 was passed bool from Bottleneck/BatchNorm/cond/pred_id:0 incompatible with expected float.

Any help is greatly appreciated!
body:
@Androbin thanks a ton for this code, it's an excellent starting point. Apologies for further questions:
1. del node.input[2] fails in scenarios where I have `node.input = ['phase_train','phase_train']`. Why is this important?
2. If I comment out `del node.input[2]`, your code converts Switch ops to Identity ops and removes the second redundant input. However, I end up with errors such as `Input 0 of node Bottleneck/BatchNorm/cond/Switch_2 was passed bool from Bottleneck/BatchNorm/cond/pred_id:0 incompatible with expected float.`

Any help is greatly appreciated!
